[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unlock Civics: {1_Civics}

The symbols displayed inside the technology node represent new units, buildings, wonders, and abilities that are unlocked by the technology once it is completed. For example, once you have finished researching the Pottery technology, you will be able to construct the Granary building in all of your cities. Your Builders will also gain the ability to harvest Wheat resources near your city. While harvesting a Wheat resource gives you a large amount of [ICON_Food] Food, that resource is removed from the map. In most cases, it is better to nurture a Wheat resource by building a Farm improvement on it instead.

Ditt folks tekniska utveckling uppnås genom forskning.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Genom att utveckla nya vetenskaper kommer du att låsa upp nya sätt att utnyttja marken, nya militära enheter, nya förbättringar av städerna, och mycket mer.
Precis som byggandet av nya enheter får ”bränsle” från [ICON_Production] Produktion, så får utvecklingen av nya vetenskaper bränsle från [ICON_Science] Vetenskap.

Varje stad i ditt rike genererar en liten mängd [ICON_Science] Vetenskap per omgång. Hur snabbt dina forskningsprojekt fullbordas beror på hur mycket [ICON_Science] Vetenskap som genereras av dina städer. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ju mer [ICON_Science] Vetenskap du genererar, desto fortare kan du utveckla nya vetenskaper.
Välj Konstbevattning från Forskningsväljarpanelen.
VÄLJ FORSKNING
Klicka på knappen ”Välj Forskning” för att visa Forskningspanelen.
(För handledningens skull så har vi snabbat på tillverkningen av den här enheten. Normalt skulle tillverkningen ha behövt ytterligare ett antal omgångar för att bli klar.)
Click the Choose Production notification to open the city’s Production Menu.
Klicka på Krigar-enheten för att välja den.
Alla Stambyar ger en belöning när de utforskas av en spelare. Den här Stambyn har gett dig en ny Spejarenhet, som har dykt upp i din stad.
Continue exploring the world with your Scout. End turn when its action is complete.
Din civilisation kommer alltid forska fram nya vetenskaper. Eftersom du just blivit klar med Gruvdrift måste du nu välja vad du vill forska fram härnäst, innan du kan fortsätta till nästa spelomgång.
Forskningen av vetenskapen Krukmakeri har börjat. Avsluta din spelomgång efter att du har flyttat din Spejare.

To win a game of Civilization, you need to defeat all other civilizations in the world. There are multiple ways to achieve this. Most games will also end in the year 2050 or after a set number of turns. If no player has achieved these Victories by then, score will determine the winner. Score is calculated as a general measure of each player’s achievements in all fields of endeavor.
The status of each Victory’s conditions are tracked on the World Rankings panel. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Open it now.
World Rankings
Click to open the World Rankings panel
The Overall tab gives you an overview of all types of Victory and your ranking against other players
The other tabs give you more specific detail about each set of rankings. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Close the panel when you are ready to proceed.

The rest of this tutorial will help you to achieve your first Domination Victory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The goal of a Domination Victory is for your civilization to be the last to occupy its own [ICON_Capital] Capital city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For this tutorial, that means you will have to use your military to capture the [ICON_Capital] Capital city of your rival, while preventing them from taking yours.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How you ultimately achieve this will be up to you. However, we have provided three optional objectives that, if completed, will greatly assist you in achieving this.
If you are unsure about something, or are looking for more information about anything you’ve seen in this tutorial, there’s a good chance you’ll find it in the Civilopedia.
Districts are specific areas of your city dedicated to providing a specific yield. Buildings can be constructed in districts to increase that yield while also providing other benefits for your city.

For example, you have unlocked the {DISTRICT_TYPE} district which is dedicated to providing {YIELD_TYPE} to your civilization. Constructing a {DISTRICT_BUILDING} building in this district increases the {YIELD_TYPE} yield for your civilization.

To zone a district, select it in your city’s production menu as you would a building or a unit. Some districts have rules of where they can be placed, but even more important is that districts can have an even greater benefit if placed in an optimal location.

When you are ready to zone a district, the game will assist you in choosing the best location. Sometimes you might not have a valid spot in your city to place a new district right away. The location may have to be cleared of obstructions, or all of your existing city plots may already have improvements.
Expanding the size of your city is one way to gain more locations for districts, as well as improvements.

Your Majesty, if I may… Although our scientists would be willing to explore other topics of research, I feel it is best to not distract them until they have completed their current project unless absolutely necessary.

Any research progress on a technology is not lost, so there are cases where changing your research focus is strategically valid. However, it is always better to have a completed technology rather than many incomplete ones.

In Civilization VI, you can get Eureka Moments that boost your technology research through in game achievements. This Eureka Moment was gained by discovering a natural wonder. Other achievements could be winning a battle with a specific unit or constructing a building. Achieving these greatly accelerates your technological progress.
Scouts are ideal for investigating Tribal Villages because they receive experience from it.

Any production progress on an item in the queue is not lost, so there are cases where changing your city’s production focus is strategically valid. However, it is often best to finish what you have started before starting something new.

Du noterade kanske att din Byggar-enhet försvann efter att den använde sin sista byggnation. Detta skedde eftersom sista delen av dess arbetsstyrka förbrukades. Du kommer behöva utbilda fler Byggare under spelets gång för att förbättra markerna runt dina städer.
Scouts, unlike other military units, gain experience from exploring Tribal Villages. They can also gain experience from discovering natural wonders in the world.

You may have noticed that your cities have been generating a small amount of [ICON_Faith] Faith each turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Faith] Faith is earned over time by certain buildings, districts, and policies.
Now that you’ve earned enough [ICON_Faith] Faith, you are able to take the first step towards founding a Religion by forming a Pantheon, which will provide you with a choice of strategic benefits.
Choose Pantheon
Click the Religion button to open the Religion screen and choose a Pantheon.

There are many Pantheons to choose from with different gameplay effects. Once one is chosen by a player, it is removed from the list of available Pantheons and is exclusive to that player’s religion for the duration of the game. Choose wisely!
Choose a Pantheon, then click the 'Found this Pantheon' button when you are done.

Well done! The next step is to attract a Great Prophet, who will be able to found a Religion. But first, you will need to build a Holy Site district, or enact an appropriate government policy, both of which will earn you Great Prophet Points.

There are a limited number of opportunities to found a Religion. Doing so is optional, but keep in mind that if you do not, you may not have an effective counter against a player who is seeking a Religious Victory by converting your [ICON_Citizen] Citizens.
Close Religion

Your [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet has founded a new Religion, and you must customize it by selecting a name, symbol, and selecting two additional religious beliefs that will complement the Pantheon belief you selected previously.

Your new Religion can spread between cities, converting its [ICON_Citizen] Citizens into followers. It is possible for a city to have a mix of several Religions. The Religion with the majority of followers in a city will be the one that imparts its bonuses.

While Religion will slowly spread from city to city organically, you can cause sudden shifts by training Missionary and Apostle units and sending them out to spread your people’s Religion. These units can be obtained by spending [ICON_Faith] Faith to buy them in the Purchase tab of a city’s Production Menu.

Aggressively spreading your Religion is essential if you are targeting a Religious Victory. Even if you are not, it is wise to keep track of how Religion is spreading around the world. Counter it where possible to mitigate the chances of another player claiming Victory this way.

You have gained the opportunity to claim a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person for your civilization. [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People provide significant benefits to your civilization based on their field. There are many types of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People, including artists, engineers, and military leaders.
Great People
Open the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People panel to claim your [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.
This is the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People panel. It shows all the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People that are currently available for civilizations to claim, their benefits, and their costs.

Each [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person has one or more opportunities to activate a special bonus. They will appear as a unit in one of your cities and you must Activate their bonus at a special location on the map. Once they have used all their bonuses, the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person will disappear.

A [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person is earned by saving up enough [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People Points of its type, then spending them to recruit the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person to your civilization. These points come primarily from districts and buildings, but can also come from policies and other effects. If you are in a rush, you can spend [ICON_Gold] Gold or [ICON_Faith] Faith to instantly earn the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person you want.

You can choose to pass on a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person that you don’t want. If you do this, then other players will have the opportunity to claim them, and your choice to pass is not reversible. However, your [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People Points will be saved for a future opportunity.
You’ve just completed a Trader unit. Traders travel between two cities and generate income for their city of origin.
Your civilization can establish a limited number of [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. You can expand this capacity with Commercial Hub or Harbor districts.
Assign Trade Route
Click the 'Assign Trade Route' unit action.
There are no other cities to trade with right now. Continue to explore the map, or build a Settler and found a new city of your own.

This is the Trade Panel, showing the cities that you can trade with currently. Traders have a limited range, but visiting nearby cities will establish a Trading Post there, allowing them to be used as a bridge to farther destinations.

Depending on the buildings and districts within a foreign destination, you stand to earn yields of [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith, [ICON_Culture] Culture, or [ICON_Gold] Gold each turn for a set number of turns. For domestic destinations, you can earn [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production.
Select the destination of your choice from the list of available cities.
Click 'Begin Route' to send this Trader on its way to the destination.
This Trader will now travel to the destination and back, generating the relevant yields each turn. Once it has returned, you can choose a new route.
The Trader will also build a Road between the cities as it goes. Units travelling a road generally suffer no terrain [ICON_Movement] Movement penalties.

You have discovered a nearby city-state. These are mini-civilizations that are similar in some ways to another player, but they can only ever have a single city and cannot win the game. By working with your city-state neighbors, you can build lucrative relationships and even gain their support in war.

You can also choose to forcefully assimilate their cities into your empire or raze them to the ground – but they are far more formidable than Barbarians to defeat, and you risk alienating their other allies.
Click the city-state button or click the city-state to open the city state panel.

This is the city-state panel. You can earn Envoys and dispatch them to a city-state. Doing this can earn you progressively better buffs to [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Production] Production, [ICON_Gold] Gold, or [ICON_Faith] Faith. Click the name of a city-state in the list.

These are the Quests you can complete for this city-state. This is one way to earn Envoys and improve your friendship with it. You can also earn Envoys by completing certain items in the Civics Tree, and over time through governments and policies.
Your unit is getting close to an enemy city. Attacking cities is usually a difficult and potentially costly undertaking that requires a mix of unit types and a tactical approach.
The city’s defense rating and health bar is shown on its Name Plate. This city has Walls. It will be able to launch a ranged attack from 2 hexes away, and will be highly resistant to melee units.

Certain siege units can improve your chances. Catapults can attack from range and do significant damage to Walls, while the Battering Ram or Siege Tower allows melee units to attack Walls or bypass them, respectively.

You have met the leader of another civilization. In Civilization VI, there will typically be several other civilizations sharing the world map with you. These are controlled by the game AI, and have all the same abilities – and ambitions – that you do.
As you play, you will need to consider how to deal with your neighbors and watch them carefully to improve your understanding of their strategy.
Leaders of civilizations you have met in the game will appear here. The leader icon on the far right represents your civilization. All other leaders will be listed to next to yours.
Leader Diplomacy
Click the other civilization leader's icon to access the Diplomacy view.
When you contact another leader, you can take a variety of actions, like exchanging goods, negotiating political treaties, making demands, or declaring war.
You can send a Delegation to improve your ties and expose more information about their [ICON_Capital] Capital city.

Denouncing a rival notifies all other civilizations that you have a bone to pick. This paves the way to war. If you do not make your feelings known, the war you declare will be a Surprise War, inflicting a lasting “Warmonger” reputation on you that may color future dealings with other leaders.

You can also negotiate deals with a leader. This can include trading commodities or political deals like Open Borders or Joint War. Alternatively, you can demand that they deal with you. This will sour your relationship, but they may acquiesce if they are weak or wish to avoid war.
What you know about this leader is summarized here. Be mindful of their Agendas. If you act in opposition to their Agendas, your relationship with them may sour and potentially lead to conflict.

Improving your Access Level to this civilization will expose more detailed information about them, and you’ll be notified when they take certain actions. It's a good idea to improve this as much as possible with the leaders you encounter, or you will be in the dark as to their strategy.

This section explains what the leader thinks about you, and why. If you wish to improve (or sour) your relationship, you’ll find some suggestions here. It may not be possible to avoid doing something that annoys them from time to time, so it can be useful to know how to balance the books.

Diplomacy will become increasingly important as you progress through history. Who your neighbors are and want they want will have a lasting impact on the development of your civilization – and will almost certainly present obstacles in your path to victory.
En stadstat är en liten civilisation som inte kan vinna spelet. Att etablera goda diplomatiska relationer med dem kan vara väldigt lönsamt. Detta görs genom att skicka Sändebud till stadsstaten.

Trader units can be trained in one of your cities. In addition to providing additional [ICON_Gold] Gold and other benefits to your civilization, [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes are essential for building roads between cities.
Välkommen, Kleopatra. Vårt folks öde ligger i dina händer. Ett stort ansvar har lagts på dina axlar. Kanske jag kan vara till hjälp?
Välkommen, Gilgamesh. Vårt folks öde ligger i dina händer. Ett stort ansvar har lagts på dina axlar. Kanske jag kan vara till hjälp?
Alltför länge har vi strövat runt i världen utan något land som vi kan kalla vårt eget. Det är hög tid att vi slår oss ned.
Vår modiga Nybyggare väntar på din befallning. Vi borde grunda vår första stad här.
Från det här fröet till stad ska ett imperium växa fram. Men för att staden verkligen ska frodas måste vi först se till våra undersåtars behov.
The lands before us offer untold riches and dangers. You must consider that carefully when choosing their final destination.
Även om staden är lite nu, så kommer den fortsätta att växa om du tillåter det. Stadens och dess invånares öde beror på dig.
Vi har tur att marken som omgärdar vår stad är rik på resurser. Att utveckla den kommer vara nyckeln till vår överlevnad...
Vi kan skatta oss lyckliga att vi har så rika marker innanför vår gräns. Men glöm inte att en civilisation består av människor, inte bara mark.
Så rika marker som dessa kommer säkert uppmärksammas av de barbarer som härjar i området. Vi måste vara beredda att slå tillbaka om vi ska kunna överleva.
Vår stad behöver Krigare.
Om vårt folk ska kunna överleva i det här området måste vi fokusera deras ansträngningar. Bara då kan vi bemästra världen.
Vårt folks säkerhet är vårt viktigaste bekymmer. Instruera din stad att skapa en Krigare.
Utbildningen av den nya enheten har påbörjats. Vårt folk känner sig redan säkrare.
Vårt imperium kommer inte byggas över en natt. Vi har gjort allt vi kan göra den här dagen.
There are no other matters for you to attend to.
Utbildningen av våra Krigare fortsätter. Men om vi ska bli någonting mer än de barbarstammar som ansätter oss måste vi också utvecklas på andra sätt.
Det finns de bland oss som har intellektet att låsa upp världens hemligheter. Vi behöver bara vägleda dem.
Utmärkt. När vårt folks förståelse av jorden ökar, så ökas också vår förmåga att utnyttja dess rikedomar och öka vår produktionskapacitet. Vi måste ge dem tid att göra sitt arbete.
There are no more matters requiring your attention today.
Barbarer närmar sig vår stad! Vi är säkert ett för begärligt mål för att de bara ska ignorera oss.
Vi kan inte tillåta dessa vildar att plundra och förstöra allt som vi har byggt. Våra Krigare har slutfört sin utbildning. Låt oss skicka ut dem i strid!
Krigare är den klinga med vilken vi kommer slå ned vår fiende. De behöver bara vårt handlag för att vägleda dem.
Seger! Barbarerna har lärt sig att vi inte är att leka med. Men de kommer att återvända, och nästa gång befarar jag att de kommer ta oss på större allvar.
Vi borde dra nytta av det här uppehållet i fientligheterna. Nu när våra Krigare är förberedda så kan vi växla över vår produktionskapacitet till staden själv.
Utmärkt. De färdigheter som Byggaren kommer få kommer att förbättra vår civilisation rejält.
Marken som omger vår stad är bördig. Men just nu är den outvecklad. Vi måste skapa en arbetsstyrka om vi ska kunna göra det mesta av resurserna innanför våra gränser.
We have no more matters that require your attention today.
Vi får inte glömma bort världen bortanför våra gränser medan Byggarna utbildas för att förbättra livet innanför dem. Det enda sättet att verkligen bemästra den här världen är att förstå den.
I tillägg till strid fungerar våra Krigare också som utmärkta utforskare i den här osäkra och fientliga världen. Du behöver bara säga till, så kommer de ge sig ut i det okända.
Vildmarken skulle vara ansträngande för våra trupper att traversera när de ger sig ut ensamma och till fots. Kanske finns det en jämnare väg…
Våra Krigares ansträngningar bär redan frukt. De har upptäckt en liten Stamby.
De här byborna verkar vänligare än de barbarstammar som vi har stött på hittills. Kanske vi borde ta kontakt istället för att attackera dem.
We have attended to all matters necessary today.
Våra krigare står framför byns portar. De väntar på ditt kommando att gå in.

Det verkar som att vänskap har sina fördelar. Ryktet om våra framgångar mot barbarerna har nått fram till den här byn. Imponerade som de är av vår kultur bestämmer de sig för att resa sig mot sina förtryckare och förena sig med oss i kampen mot horden.

Även om de saknar färdighet i strid har den här stammen ändå stor kunskap om vildmarken. Deras förmåga att röra sig snabbt genom terrängen gör dem till idealiska Spejare. Vi borde se till att dra nytta av det.
There may be other like-minded settlements in the lands ahead. We would be wise to seek them out in the future...
Vi bör använda de här Spejarna med försiktighet. De är utmärkta utforskare, men dåliga kämpar. Det vore klokt att låta dem undvika strid om möjligt.
No other matters require your attention today.
Utforskning kan ge många belöningar, men låt oss inte glömma vår huvudstads säkerhet. Vi borde skicka hem våra Krigare för att skydda staden.
Våra Spejare väntar på instruktioner. De måste utforska och lära oss om nya områden som ännu inte upptäckts.
Det finns inga fler ärenden som måste hanteras i dag.
Our people are hard at work fulfilling your orders. Let us take this time to further advance our Scouts.
No other matters require your attention today.
Våra invånare gläds åt våra modiga Krigares återkomst. Kanske de borde befästa sin position för att försvara sig mot hotet från barbarerna.
Utmärkt. Med våra Krigare förskansade i sin position är våra invånare säkra. Det vore klokt att behålla den här fördelen så länge det är möjligt.

Medan våra trupper förbereder stadens försvar har våra främsta tänkare upptäckt hur man extraherar värdefulla resurser ur jorden. Med ett överflöd av värdefull Sten i närheten, skulle våra Byggare kunna använda den här kunskapen när de är klara med sin träning.
Vårt folk finner nöje i att söka kunskap. Vi behöver bara peka ut riktningen för deras ansträngningar, så kommer de avslöja ytterligare ett av världens mysterier.
Ett klokt beslut. Vårt folk kan nu upptäcka nya användningsområden för de ämnen som vi bryter i våra Gruvor och Stenbrott.
Men låt oss inte glömma bort vår Spejares utforskning. Det finns en hel värld för oss att upptäcka.
Låt oss vända blicken mot vår huvudstad medan våra Spejare fortsätter sin upptäcksresa. Allt eftersom staden växer, så växer också hungern i våra invånares magar…
Våra Byggare står nu redo. Att konstruera en Bondgård på bördig mark innanför stadsgränsen kommer öka avkastningen och ge mer mat till vår befolkning.
Den här Slätten har rik mylla. Ett perfekt ställe att plantera våra första grödor…
Utmärkt. Med sina magar fulla trivs vårt folk, och befolkningsmängden kan öka…
Men kom ihåg, Byggarna har inte obegränsat med styrka. Vi bör se till att använda deras förmågor på bästa sätt innan vi kör slut på dem.
Med deras grundläggande behov tillgodosedda, kan vårt folk nu konstruera mer avancerade strukturer. Kanske ett Monument över allt som de har uträttat skulle inspirera dem att utvecklas ännu mer?…
Utmärkt. När vårt folks stolthet över sin egen kultur växer kommer de sprida vår civilisation bortom våra nuvarande gränser.
Och följa i våra modiga Spejares fotspår.
Nu när vårt folk fått mat, låt oss rikta våra Byggares uppmärksamhet någon annanstans. Det finns värdefulla resurser kring vår stad som vi ännu inte utnyttjat.
Rikta våra Byggares ansträngningar mot att utvinna dessa värdefulla ämnen.
Utmärkt. Den Sten som vi utvinner från det här Stenbrottet kommer öka vår produktionsförmåga.
Det verkar som att några av våra undersåtar fortfarande behöver din vägledning…
Med vårt Stenbrott nu färdigt måste vi rikta våra Byggares uppmärksamhet mot ytterligare andra förbättringar.
Det finns fortfarande värdefulla marker innanför våra gränser; vi måste vägleda dem med omsorg.
Våra undersåtar väntar fortfarande på din befallning.
We are blessed. This Monument stands as symbol of the accomplishments and determination of our people. Truly they shall now be inspired to push even further into the lands beyond.
Perhaps we are now ready to spread our civilization beyond our Capital city. If we do not claim the surrounding territory, others surely will.
Excellent, these brave Settlers are ready to carry our culture into the unknown. However, it will take some time before they are prepared for the journey that awaits them.
There are reports of dangerous raiders roaming the lands nearby. It would be best to keep these Warriors here, seeing to the safety of our Capital.
Our Settlers have finished preparations and await your command. However, the lands before them possess untold dangers. We must not allow them to go forth without protection...
Excellent, with our people prepared we must now choose our destination.
There is an area rich in resources not far from the Capital. Let us send our Settlers there.
Though our Settlers are safe under the protection of our Warriors, our Capital is now defenseless. Without the protection of the military we will most surely become overrun by our enemies.
Though our Warriors are valiant a proper fighting force must be diversified. Slingers provide a different style of combat.
With knowledge comes opportunity. As our people's understanding of this world grows, new paths present themselves to us...
Location is critical in founding a new settlement. We are fortunate to have discovered such an ideal place.
Order our people to take root here.
Well done. Our civilization continues to spread beyond expectation. In time it may rival even our own Capital.
Already this new city yearns to grow. Its people await your guidance.
We have reports of another civilization growing on this continent. It seems we are not the only people competing for control of these lands.
It would seem we have finally tracked the Barbarian raiders plaguing these lands to their source. We must destroy this stronghold or risk future attacks.
Still might I advise caution. Though primitive and savage, these Barbarians are fierce warriors and their camp is heavily defended. To ensure victory we must attack with overwhelming force.
Vår stad fortsätter blomstra. Vårt folk frodas, och befolkningen växer!
Although our scientists would be willing to explore other topics of research, perhaps it is not wise to distract them from their current work unless absolutely necessary.
The task at hand is of critical importance. Might I advise patience in this matter. We should allow our people to continue their work if at all possible.
We have spotted another friendly village nearby. Perhaps we should send a Scout to investigate.

A good city can become a great city through careful planning. Deciding where to place a city district is an important decision. Be sure to pick a location best suited for the district to reap the most benefit.
Our legacy will one day be recorded beyond the spoken word.
It appears our Slingers have completed their training. Already the people of our city feel safer...
As our army continues to diversify and improve, our future grows even more secure.
With our Slingers training complete, we may now direct our people's efforts to new pursuits.
Our people still await your command.

With Writing we unify our people. A common written language allows ideas to flourish and our collective knowledge to grow. Were we to provide a place to collect and share this knowledge our people would surely prosper...
By concentrating like minds and resources into districts we specialize the growth of our city. We must choose the location of these districts carefully in order to reap the most benefit.
Already the greatest minds in our civilization eagerly await the completion of this Campus...
But we must not allow these great thinkers to be idle. Let us turn their attention elsewhere...
Our greatest scholars and scientists already begin to gather at our Campus. Providing them with a Library would further assist them in their pursuits.
Our people have prospered under your guidance. Truly our civilization has no equal. Perhaps now is the time for you to prove this to be true.

The task before us is great, but under your leadership we shall not fail. As always I stand ready at your side should you require any assistance along the way. May our civilization truly stand forever.
We are victorious! You are now ready to take on bigger challenges, explore new worlds, meet new civilizations, and to achieve victory on your own terms.
Resources and land are not infinite. It seems we now have competition. As we do not yet know the true intention of this people, might I suggest we proceed with caution.
War is upon us! Our people are in danger. We must mobilize an army immediately or risk being conquered. There is no time for delay!
Vårt folk frodas verkligen under din vägledning. Men allt eftersom vår civilisation växer, måste vårt ledarskap också utvecklas.
Vi måste nu bestämma politiska inriktningar för att bättre styra vårt folks tillväxt…

Disciplin är varje armés ryggrad, och en värdefull fördel över det oorganiserade barbarpacket. Stadsplanering kommer bara göra våra städer mer organiserade och effektiva. Jag föreslår att vi antar båda dessa politiska inriktningar.
Though our policies begin to bear fruit our civilization will only continue to grow. We must plan for the future...
Our people have looked to the heavens, and begun to wonder if our fortunes may be guided by the hands of a greater power. Who are these great gods, and what blessings might they bestow upon us?

Your inspiration is contagious. Though our civilization achieves greatness under your leadership, one amongst our people truly shines above all others. Under your guidance shall their impact truly reverberate throughout history.
Isolation is not the key to prosperity. These traders allow us to reach out to our neighbors. Through trade, we stand to boost our economy, and gain new insights into the mysteries of the world.
We have made contact with people more advanced than the Tribal Villagers who have aided us in the past. Should we extend the hand of friendship or look to conquer them?
The beauty and majesty of this world is sometimes enough to inspire our people to new directions of thought. This was a fortunate discovery...
Again our brave Scouts prove their worth to our people.
May I make a suggestion…
As you wish.
We have spotted another friendly village nearby. Perhaps we should send a Scout to investigate.
